means: 传播（谣言、消息等）（常为漫不经心地）

sentence.Network_en: Ivar's bandy legs seemed to have grown shorter.
sentence.Network_cn: 埃法尔的两条罗圈腿看着短得多了.

sentence.Network_en: Bandy sesame seed: Yes Renqiu unique traditional flavor snacks, exquisite craftsmanship.

sentence.Network_en: We can't take you seriously when you just bandy words.
sentence.Network_cn: 当你们仅仅是互相斗嘴时我们不能当真.

lj.lj_ly: I'm not going to &B{bandy words with} you.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: perhaps from obsolete bandy 'curved stick used in hockey'
late 16th cent. (in the sense 'pass (a ball) to and fro'): perhaps from French bander 'take sides at tennis', from bande 'band, crowd' (see band)

entry.def: If you bandy words with someone, you argue with them.

example.ex: Brand shook his head. He was tired of bandying words with the man...
example.tran: 布兰德摇了摇头。他已经厌烦了和这个男人斗嘴。

example.ex: The prosecution and defense were bandying accusations back and forth.
example.tran: 原告和被告你来我往，互相指责。

means.word_mean: 1. toss or strike a ball back and forth
1. have legs that curve outward at the knees

auth_sentence.content: Everyone has an opinion and wants to bandy it about.

auth_sentence.content: We all speak, after all, and bandy slang terms around constantly.
